block.p: FINKLESTEIN-Marilyn. The East End Chapter/Jeanne Kaye League of City of Hope would like to extend its deepest condolences to Dr. Howard Finklestein and family on the loss of Marilyn Finklestein, devoted East End Chapter/Jeanne Kaye League member. Please know our thoughts, love and prayers are with you at this time of sadness.

FINKLESTEIN - Marilyn. Sutton Place Synagogue extends heartfelt condolences to our dedicated members Beverly and Robert Litsky on the loss of Beverly's beloved mother. May the bereaved family be comforted by their cherished memories. Allan Schranz, Rabbi Robert W. Berend, President

FINKLESTEIN-Marilyn. On Oct 17, 2000 in Miami, Florida. Beloved wife of Dr. Howard. Loving mother of Beverly and Robert Litsky and Jane and Charles Fina. Cherished grandmother of Matthew, Pamela, Farin, Michael, Jeffrey & Steven. Dear aunt of Barbara Berger. Services today 11:45am, ''The Riverside'' 76 St & Amsterdam Av
FINKLESTEIN-Marilyn. My dearest friend, we shared so many happy memories together. You will live in my heart forever. I will always miss and love you. Bunny
FINKLESTEIN-Marilyn. You were our dearest cousin and a very special friend. We will cherish the wonderful memories of a lifetime. Muriel & Renee and their families
